title: Activision, Apple, Tesla, Goldman Sachs: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Activision Blizzard shares soared on a deal with Microsoft; Goldman Sachs reported a profit drop
text:
* Technology giants were absorbing the brunt of the premarket gloom. Shares of Tesla, Twitter, Meta Platforms, Amazon.com and Apple were all down in morning trading.

* Electric-vehicle makers overall were losing their charge, including Lucid Group, China's Nio and Lordstown Motors.

* Bank of New York Mellon said its profit rose for the fourth quarter as fee revenue increased 4%, reflecting higher market values and client volumes.

* Goldman Sachs said its profit fell in the fourth quarter, even as the deals market stayed strong.

The Goldman Sachs building Lower Manhattan, Jan. 6, 2022. Goldman Sachs is an investment banking company. PHOTO: Gabby Jones for The Wall Street Journal

* Energy companies were a small bright spot, with their shares gaining on higher crude prices, including Occidental Petroleum, ConocoPhillips and Exxon Mobil.

* Activist investor Macellum Advisors is renewing a push to get department-store chain Kohl's to take action to boost its lagging stock.

* In his annual letter to the CEOs of the companies in which BlackRock invests, Larry Fink said businesses that don't plan for a carbon-free future risk being left behind.

* J.B. Hunt Transport Services is due to report earnings after Tuesday's close.

Chart of the Day

* As the Federal Reserve moves closer to raising interest rates, investors are repricing their bets on one of the riskiest corners of the market: shares of companies that don't make money.
